title: Our Classes
subtitle: Choose the class that fits your level and start your yoga journey today.
beginnerDesc: Perfect for newcomers. Learn foundational poses and breathing techniques in a supportive and friendly environment.
intermediateDesc: Designed for practitioners with some experience. Deepen your practice with longer sequences and more challenging poses.
advancedDesc: Push your limits with advanced asanas, complex sequences, and mindfulness techniques for serious practitioners.

ashtanga.title: Ashtanga Yoga
ashtanga.text:
Ashtanga Vinyasa Yoga is an active yoga style with a set sequence of postures linked with vinyasas. It develops discipline, flexibility, and focus, turning practice into meditation in motion.

The Primary Series (Yoga Chikitsa) creates heat and helps eliminate toxins. At Inside Yoga we offer Ashtanga for Beginners — a shortened sequence with slower pace and step-by-step instruction.

Schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri 17:00–18:15; Tue, Thu 20:15–21:30.

spicedAshtanga.title: Spiced Ashtanga
spicedAshtanga.text:
Guided Ashtanga first-series classes with occasional additions from the second series. Suitable for beginners and intermediate practitioners with a focus on the Trishtana method.

Schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri 18:45–20:00.

mysore.title: Mysore Class
mysore.text:
Mysore-style Ashtanga practice is a self-paced practice in the presence of a teacher who gives adjustments and guidance. New students are given a shorter sequence that grows over time.

Practice window: 07:30–09:30 (Tue & Thu).

power.title: Power Yoga
power.text:
Power Yoga is an active, dynamic form focusing on strength, endurance and faster flows. It uses breath and bandhas but sequences are not fixed. Great for fitness-minded practitioners and those seeking intensity.

Schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri 20:15–21:30 (online).

vinyasa.title: Vinyasa Flow
vinyasa.text:
Vinyasa Flow links postures with vinyasas and breath. The teacher sequences classes to match the group’s needs and the class energy—creative and flowing.

Schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri 09:30–10:45; Tue & Thu 18:45–20:00.

restorative.title: Restorative + Yoga Nidra
restorative.text:
Restorative classes are slow, with fewer asanas and an emphasis on breath. They activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress—often followed by Yoga Nidra, a guided deep relaxation.

Schedule: Sat 18:30–19:15.

yin.title: Yin Yoga
yin.text:
Yin Yoga is a slow practice where poses are held from 45 seconds up to several minutes to work the connective tissues. It increases joint circulation and deepens flexibility while cultivating stillness.

Schedule: Weekly, 18:30–20:00.
